fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30719].
  {panel}

The filter in the space directory is useful to reduce the long list of wikis. Given the following wiki names:
# "abcd efgh"
# "bcde"
# "x yz"

When entering a keyword the filter applies only when the text starts with the searchterm.
* Searching for "bc" only wiki 2 is shown.
* Searching for "ef" no wiki is shown.
* Searching for "*ef" an error is shown: "error applying filter".

I recommend two improvements:
* when the space directory is opened the filter field should be focused automatically so the user starts typing for filter without clicking (this is a standard behaviour in the link menu, create menu so why not here.
* no matter what I enter this string should be _anywhere_ inside wiki name, description or space category. when entering two strings with a space ("string1 string2") the space should be interpreted like a section of SELECT-Queries: show all entries containing string1 anywhere AND containing string2 anywhere.

Improvement 2 should be used in all search or filter menus - I found the filter for groups difficulties handling more than two asterix. This way the place of the string doesn't matter - names can be in any order.
fields.summary: Improve searching in the space directory to support substrings and/or wildcards

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a new test user
# Add the newly created user into {{confluence-administrators}} group
# Disabled the new test user
# Access the following URL
{code}<Server Base URL>/500page.jsp{code}
# Click the "Confluence Administrators" link which will redirect you to this URL 
{code}<Server Base URL>/contactadministrators.action{code}
# Send the "Contact Administrators" form

h3. Expected Results:

Confluence should respect the status of the member of {{confluence-administrators}}, whether it is disabled or not. Sending an e-mail to a disabled user is a broken process.

h3. Actual Results:

Confluence does not respect the "ACTIVE" parameter in the database and blindly send email to all members of {{confluence-administrators}}
fields.summary: "Contact Administrators" Process Doesn't Exclude Disabled Administrators

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Upload this PDF file to Confluence page: [^Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf]
# Go to Insert > Other Macros > PDF
# Try to preview this PDF.
# Confluence will crash.

Error in atlassian-confluence.log:
{code}
2013-09-10 16:33:01,427 WARN [http-8523-3] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf with page number 0, waited : 300, now executing in background.
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
2013-09-10 16:33:01,750 WARN [http-8523-3] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf with page number 0, waited : 300, now executing in background.
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
2013-09-10 16:33:02,069 WARN [http-8523-3] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf with page number 0, waited : 300, now executing in background.
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
2013-09-10 16:33:02,384 WARN [http-8523-3] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf with page number 0, waited : 300, now executing in background.
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
2013-09-10 16:33:37,774 WARN [http-8523-3] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf with page number 0, waited : 300, now executing in background.
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin.
{code}

Tomcat window freezed:
!tomcat.jpg!

Java process hanged:
!java.jpg!

h5. Workaround:
Insert the PDF file into Confluence page using HTML macro in combination with iframe:
# Enable HTML macro module ((html-xhtml) from Manage Add-Ons > System Plugins > Confluence HTML Macros
# Go to a Confluence page > Insert > Other Macros > HTML
# Inside the HTML tag include the following iframe:
{code}
<iframe src="http://confluence.atlassian.com/confluence/download/attachments/1114129/Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf?api=v2" width="100%" style="height:50em" />
{code}
# Save page
# Result: The PDF is rendered fine in the page and Confluence is not crashing



Note: You may replace the attachment link accordingly

In 5.2.3, you'll need to check/tick the 'Insecure: Display all attachments inline' setting in Confluence Admin > Security Configurations > Attachment Download Security Policy so that Confluence will not try to download the PDF file into your local machine and just render it in the page.

While this may be a legit workaround it has two major problems:
# PDF only gets rendered if you have an Adobe Reader Plugin or you use Firefox which uses pdf.js
# Confluence can crash any time since a user can upload a PDF and try to render it using viewxls.



*Possible Workaround* one of customers reported that upgrading java to version 7u55 stabilised the instance from the occurrence of crashes.
fields.summary: Confluence crashes visualizing a PDF with diagrams which have cubic c curve

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30709].
  {panel}

h3. Symptom

Creating issues using JIRA issues macro in Confluence will set wrong security level (ignoring default option) set in issue security level scheme.

This only affects if the user creating the issue has the permission *Set Issue Security* permission in project's permission scheme. Without the permission, issues will be created with default issue security level.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an issue security level scheme with one of security levels is set to *Default* - associate it to target project.
# Ensure that the user used has the permission *Set Issue Security* in the relevant project's permission scheme.
# Go to Confluence and create a page.
# In the editor, use *JIRA Issue* macro and select to *Create New Issue*.
# Create issue and view it in JIRA.

h3. Actual Result

Issue created via the macro doesn't have issue security level set.

h3. Expected Result

Issue should be created with the default issue security level as set in its scheme.
fields.summary: Create Issue via JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence Sets Wrong Issue Security Level

When exporting a space, the progress bar usually gets stuck at 0% or 99% for nearly the whole time, up until when the export is complete. At the end, it suddenly goes to complete. h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Find a space which includes a lot of data and/or attachments
# Go to Space Tools > Content Tools, then do a full export to XML
# Watch the progress bar as the export is made

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30701].
  {panel}

Scenario:

We use Confluence as an internal Wiki for out development department. We have organised several spaces in Confluence. Each space belongs to particular topic like UI Development, CMS Development, Component Library, System Integration, .etc. 
 
Though, we need to classify all pages in all spaces against global categories (category is represented as list of attributes), for example: Skills = { .NET, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery}; Platform = { Linux, Windows, Android, iOS }; Programming Language = { C#, C++, VB }; .etc.
 
So we would like to have an ability to specify multiple category attributes for any page in any space. So, for example, the page could be associated with Skills = { CSS, jQuery}; Platform = { Windows }; Programming Language = { C#, VB };

It also needs to be user friendly so Confluence content editors could use specify each category attributes in the similar manner in which labels are currently specified in Confluence. Though, instead of adding attributes in bulk, to a single labels list, the attributes should be added to the corresponding category. 

In addition, all exiting categories attributes mus be available in all spaces and should be globally searchable.

It would be extremely handy  to have some features in Confluence to support this scenario. 

E.g.: if it would be JIRA we would just add new multi-select fields for each category, with a pre-defined number of attributes, which can be selected for this category
fields.summary: Page related global custom fields

fields.description:
Hello,

I've come across a strange issue where we have a few restricted pages that keep appearing and disappearing (depending on if you refresh the page) from the "Child Pages" list at the bottom of the home page.

4 out of the 7 pages are restricted. The number says '3' and the list sometimes either shows all 7 pages, or just 3 (the 3 unrestricted ones). I'm using an admin account and have access to all of these pages.

Repro steps:
* Create some restricted and some unrestricted pages in the space root.
* Refresh the page (CTRL+F5) with the Child Pages list *collapsed*.
* Expand the Child Pages list and it will display all the pages. You can collapse/expand it all you like and it will remain.
* Refresh the page (CTRL+F5) with the Child Pages list *expanded*.
* Now it only displays the unrestricted pages.

Please let me know if I can provide any other useful information.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Restricted Pages disappearing/reappearing in "Child Pages" list

fields.description:
Confluence has a plugin named "Confluence Profile" installed and disabled by default in Confluence 5.2.3. This plugin feature is not documented nor mentioned on our release notes.

Customer may enable this plugin without any information what it could do or what the purposes of this plugin. This plugin will overwrite Confluence's {{profile.vmd}}  which is stored in {{<CONF_Install_Dir>/confluence/decorator/}}.

*Reason*
The plugin is shipped disable and should remain disabled. It is being modified by development team and it is currently on hold. When enabled, the profile plugin "overrides" the old profile page which is implemented as code in confluence core.
fields.summary: When the Confluence Profile Plugin is enabled, it overwrites profile.vmd

fields.description:
If you replace a word on a page and also change the formatting of the text on the page, the page history/comparison view will not show the replaced text, only the newly entered one.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page with a single sentence, save it
# Edit the page, replace one word in the sentence with something else and apply {{Preformatted}} instead of the default {{Paragraph}} on the whole sentence, save the page
# Go to *Tools > History* and compare the earlier with the current version

Notice that the formatting change and the newly entered word is present, but not the word that was removed.
fields.summary: Comparison view does not show replaced text when formatting changes

fields.description:
This affects regular editing but most easily demonstrated on a code block.

*To reproduce:*

# Create a new page.
# Enter a lines of text including indented headers and paragraphs, e.g.:\\ 
{code}
h1. Header One
    Paragraph One
    h2. Header Two
        Paragraph Two
    h2. Header Two Bee
        Paragraph Two Bee
{code}
# Position the insertion point at the start of {{h1. Header One}}.
# Press Shift+↓ five times to select lines {{Header One}} thru {{Paragraph Two Bee}},
# Press Ctrl+C to copy selection to clipboard.
# Create Enter to create a new line below {{Paragraph Two Bee}}
# Position cursor to start of new line created below {{Paragraph Two Bee}}.
# Press Ctrl+V to paste the clipboard contents.

*Expected content*

{code}
h1. Header One
    Paragraph One
    h2. Header Two
        Paragraph Two
    h2. Header Two Bee
        Paragraph Two Bee
h1. Header One
    Paragraph One
    h2. Header Two
        Paragraph Two
    h2. Header Two Bee
        Paragraph Two Bee
{code}

*Observed content*

{code}
h1. Header One
    Paragraph One
    h2. Header Two
        Paragraph Two
    h2. Header Two Bee
        Paragraph Two Bee
h1. Header One

    Paragraph One

    h2. Header Two


        Paragraph Two


    h2. Header Two Bee



        Paragraph Two Bee




{code}
fields.summary: Pasting adds extra newlines

fields.summary: Dashboard popular stream won't render when it contains content from an anonymous user

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a PDF document to a page via {{Tools >> Attachment}}
# Try clicking on the PDF attachment after it's attached

The same behavior does not occur in 5.1.x .
fields.summary: Clicking on a PDF attachment in Confluence 5.2 causes the attachment to be downloaded instead of being displayed in the browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30688].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The mobile dashboard only contains "Popular", "Blogs", and "Network" tabs. This is a ticket to track the need for more navigation capabilities within Confluence mobile

h3. Suggested Solution
 
# view parent of a given page
# view children of a given page
# view space of a given page
# view list of spaces for the site.
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator, I would like overall improved navigation on Confluence mobile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30687].
  {panel}

We need to add predefined variables that can be used in templates. The following variables are useful and need to be predefined:
* $spaceKey
* $spaceName
* $baseUrl
* $currentDate
* $author
fields.summary: Add predefined variables in templates
Remember the columns to display in the JIRA issues macro regardless if another search has happened

fields.description:
Well formed HTML causes odd behavior when being saved for 'at the end of BODY' but works fine 'at the end of HEAD' and 'at the beginning of the BODY'.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Browse to 'Confluence admin' -> 'custom HTML'
# click 'edit' and add the following to 'At the end of BODY'
{code}
<form action="http://www.example.com">
</form>
{code}
# Click 'Save"

Notice that upon saving we are redirected to a blank page with 'data:,' in the URL.  Please note also that the example form action is rather generic and this failure appears to occur with well formed AJS as well.
fields.summary: Well formed HTML causes redirect to 'data:,' when saving 'at the end of BODY' custom HTML

fields.description:
Hi there,

So we noticed that our Confluence instance's All Update tab is not being updated as people update/add new content on Confluence. It seems to be stuck at a old date and nothing new is coming in.

We already tried rebuilding the index from scratched by deleting the whole index folder and restarted the server. The problem would go away but comes back the next day.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Rebuild+the+Content+Indices+from+Scratch

We currently running Confluence 4.2.6 and we have 60GB free on the hard drive that Confluence is installed on.

Also, we noticed that newly created pages are not showing up in searches anymore. Its only matter of time that this becomes a bigger problem for us.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30676].
  {panel}

If there are multiple pages with search results and you switch to the next or previous page.
Then the labels being searched for would keep being added on top every time.

1 Go to Browse > Labels
2 Click on a label (search result with multiple pages)
3 Label is visible on top of the page
4 Go to next page of search result 

> Label where you searched for is added 2 times!

*Additional information:*
Observation:
{panel}
In test environment, looking at http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing (space with key "BUG" and showing pages in it, that have "task-missing" label). Note URL of pagination:

* Page 1: current page
* Page 2: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&startIndex=10
* Page 3: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&startIndex=20

Note that in the URL the only thing that changes is "startIndex" parameter.

Now try go to that 2nd page and here is how url looks now:

* Page 1: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&ids=3768322&startIndex=0 (note that "startIndex=0" was added it shouldn't)
* Page 2: current
* Page 3: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&ids=3768322&startIndex=20

Note that "ids" parameter is now listed twice in the URL (with identical value).
{panel}
fields.summary: Paging in label browser keeps adding labels on top of the page

fields.description:
The excerpt include is unable to find pages that are named with certain special characters.  For example ":".

Replication Steps:
1)Create a page with a special character of ":" in the name.
Save page.
Modify page to include the macro of "{excerpt}".
Type in sample text within the excerpt frame.
Save page
2) Create a new page or modify an existing page to include excerpt.
{excerpt include}
Type in your previously saved page under step 1 as a parameter value for the excerpt include.
Save page
3) Notice in confusion the lack of your excerpted sample text.  
Instead, notice that the excerpt references that your excerpted page does not exist.
"The page [Page:Title] could not be found."
4) Navigate back to your original page containing the excerpt.
Rename that page to not include the special character.
5) Navigate back to the referring page from step 2.
Modify the excerpt include reference for your newly renamed page without the excerpt.
Save page
Notice in relief that your excerpt reference has now been found.
6) Conclude that by isolating your variables and process of elimination that the special character handling for excerpt inclusion is suspect.
7) Note the workaround of not using special characters and take a little break.
fields.summary: The excerpt include is unable to find pages that are named with certain special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30654].
  {panel}

Xref: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-75308

Section 10.4.2 of RFC 2616 provides that clients can infer that they've provided the *wrong credentials* when:

a) they get back a 'WWW-Authenticate' challenge for some scheme
b) they already provided credentials for that scheme in the request

However, the REST API currently thwarts this inference by responding with a challenge *only* for the 'OAuth' scheme, even though the request provided an 'Authorization' header for the 'Basic' scheme.  

The only valid inference the client can make is therefore "I'm using the wrong scheme", and not "I'm using the wrong credentials".

Which caused me a support call, and our mutual time, lately.
fields.summary: REST API 401 responses should challenge for Basic auth, especially when Basic credentials were supplied in the request.

fields.description:
RichEditor does not allow to create a numbered/bulleted list with a few levels easly (with continue numbering)

Step to reproduce:

# Click on "Numbered list" icon on toolbar
# Input: "Test Entry #1", click Enter
# Input: "Test Entry #2", click Enter
# Input: "Test subentry level A", click Enter
# Click "up" key to move from 4-th entry to 3-rd.
# Now select the text "Test subentry level A" with Shift+End keys.
# Now click "Bullet list" icon on toolbar

What you will see:
{noformat}
1. Test Entry #1
2. Test Entry #2
 * Test subentry level A
1. 
{noformat}

It is impossible to make a bottom part of list to be a "continue numbering" list. "Indent" right on bulleted entry is do nothing with a numbering below.

So, there is no any way to make this list like that:

{noformat}
1. Test Entry #1
2. Test Entry #2
 * Test subentry level A
3. 
{noformat}

I know very idiotic and usable-less workarounds, like cutting and pasting data into middle of already written list. But this is unusable for a common users who are previously working with Microsoft Word.

Current Rich Editor have a very useless working with a list with a few levels. For example, I can use it, using WikiMarkup insertion (where I control a levels), but a common users can't.

They are very annoyed with current behaviour, because they can't write what they want.
fields.summary: RichEditor does not allow to create a numbered/bulleted list with a few levels easly (with continue numbering)

fields.summary: Excel spreadsheet with macro cause OutOfMemory issue when showing via Viewfile macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30644].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The space owner, cannot manager users watching all blog posts in their space.

Space owner can only manage watchers of specific pages/blog posts in that space.

Many users only watch the blog for keeping up with the news in the space and not the actual content.

Example:
 We have a JIRA space in our Confluence instance. This space contains all system and operational documentation of our JIRA instance. Information not so interesting to the organization. However, the blog in the JIRA space is used for information about upgrades, new features, downtime etc. This is very interesting to the users. Therefore the users only watch the blog of the space and not the space itself. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability for the space owner to manage all blog watchers.

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of November 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thank you for all voting and commenting on this feature.

We fully understand and appreciate the need to manage blog watchers. As you’ll be aware, within Confluence we already have the ability to manage page watchers – managing blog watchers is the logical next step.

This is something we’d ideally like to implement in the future, but it's not currently on our roadmap for the next 12 months. We’re instead focusing on bringing you a new search experience, and are investigating improvements to permissions.

For more context on this, take a read of the Community blog: [A renewed approach to highly voted Server suggestions for Jira and Confluence|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117].

In the meantime, we suggest taking a look at the [Better Blogs for Confluence add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.arijea.plugins.betterblogs/server/reviews].

Best
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Add possibility to manage blog watchers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30639].
  {panel}

If a site has no application links, then the 'add-link' button in the space administration screens is not very telling of this fact.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have a confluence site with no application links established
# Enter any space and click 'space tools'->'integration'
# On the resultant screen, click 'add link'
# Observe that nothing happens aside from the button highlighting

There is a note explaining that an application link needs to be established BUT it could be clearer to have the button state this as well.  Perhaps when it is clicked there is one item in the drop down which says 'no application links are established' as opposed to doing nothing.  As of right now, for all the end user knows there could be a failure loading the list.

EDIT Another thought on this, if the user clicking the button is an administrator, perhaps the item in the list could be a link to the application links section of the administrative screens.
fields.summary: Improve messaging of space integrations page when no application links are established

In Confluence 3.5, a list of the spaces on the left section of the Dashboard were presented via convenient tabs: 'All', 'Favourite', 'Category' or 'New' spaces:

fields.description:
# Create a space template.
# Enter some plain text and create a list variable.
# Save the template.
# Create a page based on the template.
New page looks good.
# Edit the template.
# Click [ <> ] (Open in source editor).
Note that list values for your new variable are stored in a <ul> structure at the top of the document.
# Click Apply.
The <ul> containing the variable values is now visible in the template.

The same thing happened with a multiline text variable--the variable definition is displayed at the top of the document in the source editor, and clicking Apply makes it visible in the template body even though no changes were made.
fields.summary: Saving a space template in source editor corrupts it

fields.description:
Was working in page with two column layout.  
I attempted to copy/Paste a section and the mouse cursor disappeared.  
I then attempted to Preview and return to Edit to get mouse cursor back--but to no avail.
I then decided to save so that I could edit later only to find that all the contents for the whole right column was gone.  This was the detailed section and I spent quite a bit of time collecting and getting the right Jira issues details in.

Support zip file is attached
fields.summary: Page content lost after copy/pasting

The generated report does not show the image but an error (see report.png). The confluence log file is not showing any problem while creating the page or displaying the report.
fields.summary: Images not shown page properties report
Provide a method for administrators to edit the Microsoft AD directory when IIS authentication is enabled

fields.description:
h3.Problem
Confluence Email Gateway does not seem to work at its fullest. While it is not documented I believe every plugin available at Admin Panel, with possibilities of editing and altering is supported if not installed by 3rd parties is (or should be) supported. Therefore this plugin does not have a documentation nor seems to work correctly.

h3.Undocumented Features
This plugin lacks implementation, and Documentation. Thus it is also required a documentation for it, whether it is supported or not.

h3.Answer lacking Official Response
There is no Official Response to this Answer:  [What is Confluence Email Gateway?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/158600/what-is-confluence-email-gateway]
fields.summary: Confluence Email Gateway does not Work

fields.description:
After creation of Application Link I see '#xsrfTokenElement()' in Authentication Configuration form.

If I try to submit this form I see error message "XSRF Security Token Missing".

I can reproduce this with Generic Application Link type as well as with our custom TeamCity Application Link


Workaround:
* Delete the application links manually
** Ensure to delete any entries related to confluence/jira in the keystore table in the confluence db
[Confluence delete applink manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Application+Link+configuration+cannot+be+deleted+via+the+UI+and+appears+as+System+Link]
[How to remove Application link directly through database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+remove+Application+link+directly+through+database]

* Follow steps to initialize keystore table in confluence in resolution:
[Unable to Add Confluence as A Trusted Application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Add+Confluence+as+A+Trusted+Application]
(i) I have tested the init_keystore_4_2.jsp with confluence 5.2.3 and it works as expected.
fields.summary: Outgoing authentication settings for generic/etc AppLinks are broken
'preview' web-resource context should include 'atl.general' resources

I tested with latest versions of Chrome, FireFox and IE and I was able to reproduce the issue.

When following the [Defining 'Priority' Field Values|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Defining+'Priority'+Field+Values] documentation to update an icon to an image held externally (accessible URL), JIRA Issues macro fails to downsize the image in Confluence pages:

In JIRA, the new icon is resized appropriately.
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# In JIRA, edit the icon of a 'Priority' - https://<baseURL>/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
# Place an accessible URL to it - e.g. http://www.nor1.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/logoAtlassianPNG.gif
# Save changes
# In Confluence, add a JIRA Issues macro that will display an issue with that priority
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro fails to downsize external icon image
Plugins default timeout value not enough, Confluence failing to start

fields.description:
In some cases editor may insert SQUARE style to a numbered list!

Here is a quote from code of page:

{noformat}
<ol style="list-style-type: square;">
{noformat}

So, in this case NUMBERED list is shown as bulleted list. But really it is NUMBERED.

I cannot say exact steps to reproduce this bug. But when it occur, it was not able to fix it with editor (changing numbered to non-numbered was not effectife). I opened code source and removed style= tag, and after this all was fine.
fields.summary: In some cases editor may insert SQUARE style to a numbered list!

fields.description:
When configuring the macro, filtering of blog posts is conducted correctly when using one label. When giving two labels as filter conditions - no matter using spaces or commas - the whole blog post list is shown -> no filter applied.

A similar configuration like the content-by-label makro selecting OR/AND-logic would be nice for use patterns regarding label filtering. This should also be unified as a filter method for all macros using label filtering! That makes learning easier!
fields.summary: Blog Posts Macro doesn't filter when multiple labels are entered

fields.description:
When copying a screenshot to the clipboard it's possible to paste it into the editor. The editor shows the picture, see background of the following picture:

!Editor after inserting pictures.png|thumbnail!

When previewing or saving the page there is a broken image-picture not clickable and only removable with keyboard commands, see next picture:

!Bug inserting pictures.png|thumbnail!

Additionally: When pasting the clipboard into the editor, the picture can be edited as any other "correctly" attached picture with menu etc. When highlighting the picture and choosing "attachments" in the editor footer, the menu with the manymanymany letters appears as shown in the first picture.
fields.summary: Editor irritates users by allows inserting pictures from clipboard but not keeping it
Set up step error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30608].
  {panel}

Every Atlassian application has different scripts formats and workflow. We should have a common format guidelines to make them consistent between applications.

This will bring us the following wins:
* Sysadmins of Atlassian products will be able to configure any product in the same way, reducing the learning curve.
* Some pages in the documentation (and also the KB space) would be valid for all products, making them easier to maintain.

I personally like the way the files are formatted in JIRA (and Bamboo) but we should agree in a common format.
fields.summary: Get consistent start, stop, configuration and installation scripts across Atlassian products

{code}

h4. Cause

There seems to be a class referenced in 3.0.5 of the WebDAV Plugin which does not exist in Confluence 5.1, 5.1.1, 5.1.2 and 5.1.3, but does exist in 5.1.4 and above.

h4. Workaround

Revert back to the bundled version of the WebDAV Plugin:

# Go to "Manage Add-Ons"
# Select the "WebDAV Plugin"
# Click "Uninstall"
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: WebDAV Plugin 3.0.5 fails to enable in all versions of Confluence from 5.1 up to 5.1.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30603].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
Open Confluence via safari from an ipad
Open a page in confluence
Click view in desktop mode
Edit page
Type some text
Use magnifier to move cursor to another location
Unable to type any new text or move cursor again
fields.summary: Editor stops working in Safari on iPad when moving cursor to new location

fields.description:
*STEPS TO REPRO*
- edit a page
- write some text
- go to a new line
- hit Ctrl+Shift+N to start a numbered list
- write the following

{quote}
# bla bla
# bla bla _bla bla_ bla bla
{quote}

- use CTRL+I to start and stop (while typing) the italic text section on the second line and leave the cursor at the end of the second line
- hit backspace

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
The last "a" of the second line is deleted, the cursor stays after the "bl" of the last "bla" of the second line.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
The cursor seems to jump in some way at the beginning of the second line, and hence the backspace deletes the "2." ahead of the second line. If you press again, you start to delete text on the first line. This is really annoying and confusing: when you type fast, the risk is to destroy parts of what you were writing and you have to do Ctrl+Z to undo and use the mouse to place back at the end of the second line, to repeat the deletion attempt.

*NOTES*
The problem does not occur if you use the underscore at the beginning and at the end of the italic section on the second line, instead of using CTRL+I.
fields.summary: Undesired cursor jump when editing a list and using keyboard shortcuts to decorate text
Uploading multiple files at the same time
Add possibility to specify macro body default value
